document_title: Mitral valve stenosis: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_content:
Criteria to evaluate the severity of mitral valve stenosis are based on echocardiographic parameters such as mean mitral valve pressure gradient, pulmonary artery pressure and valve pore area. Characteristics of specific stenosis levels are divided into mild, moderate, and severe as shown in the table below:
Parameters measured on echocardiography Degree of mitral valve stenosis Mild Moderate (severe) Mean pressure gradient across the mitral valve (mmHg) < 5 5-10 > 10 Pulmonary artery pressure (mmHg) < 30 30 – 50 > 50 Mitral valve orifice area > 1.5 1.0 – 1.5 < 1. 0
